revisions.revision: Changed almost all layout(fixed chunk clonning) Found/Named values, placement coords, transitions bitmaps,variation values,font type,scen/models...

plugin.comment: - the widget coordinate system is a left-handed system (+x to the right, +y up, +z into the screen) with the origin centered in the display (regardless of display size) - for widget component placement, all coordinates you define in the tag specifiy the object's placement prior to the application of any animation - all coordinates you define are local to that object - all text specific to objects in the screen comes from the screen's string list tag all of the string indices you may need to specify will refer to the screen's string list tag - a pane may contain either buttons OR a list OR a table-view, but never a combination of those (widget won't function correctly if you try that) - all text is centered unless you specify otherwise

bit.name: Multiple Panes Are For List Flavor Items

option.name: Player Profile High Score Rec Settings
Player Profile Profile Delete Confirmation Dlg
Edit Jug Pts For Killing Jugger
Edit CTF Flag At Home To Score
Edit Assault Enemy Flag At Home To Score
Edit Indicator Players On Motion Sensor
Edit Indicator Invisible Players On Motion Sensor

enum16.name: Button Key
enum16.tooltip: The labels here are just a guide; the actual string used comes from the Nth position of this button key entry as found in the ui globals button key string list tag

colorf.name: Default Text Color
colorf.tooltip: Any ui elements that don't explicitly set a text color will use this color

tagRef.name: Screen String List Tag
tagRef.tooltip: All text specific to this screen

tagblock.name: Panes
tagblock.tooltip: Define the screen's panes here (normal screens have 1 pane, tab-view screens have 2+ panes)

tagblock.name: Buttons
tagblock.tooltip: If the pane contains buttons, define them here

tagblock.name: List Definition
tagblock.tooltip: If the pane contains a list, define it here

tagblock.name: Item Text-Value Pairs
tagblock.tooltip: If you want to control item text-value pairing manually, add them here.
tagblock.comment: Enter the value in the box corresponding to the value type you specified above
This is text string associated with data when it has the value specified above. The string comes from the screen's string list tag.

tagblock.name: Obsolete Table View
tagblock.tooltip: If the pane contains a table-view, define it here

bit.name: Ignore For List Skin Size Calculation

tagblock.name: Model Scene Blocks
tagblock.comment: Halo y-axis=ui z-axis, and Halo z-axis=ui y-axis. As a convention, let's always place objects in the ui scenario such that they are facing in the '-y' direction, and the camera such that is is facing the '+y' direction. This way the ui animation for models (which gets applied to the camera) will always be consisitent.

If you need general purpose text-value pairs for the contents of this pane, define them here. NOTE: special code will be needed to hook these into anything. They are useful for things such as custom text labels that change depending on the currently selected list item, or current value of some game setting. Thanks, have a nice day. -Stefan

tagblock.name: Text Value Pairs
tagblock.comment: Enter the value in the box corresponding to the value type you specified above
This is text string associated with data when it has the value specified above. The string comes from the screen's string list tag.

enum16.name: Shape Group
enum16.tooltip: If the screen is to have a shape group, specify it here (references group in user interface globals tag)

plugin.comment: These are down here because they got added on later. Have a nice day.

tagblock.name: Local Strings
tagblock.tooltip: String IDs here allow defining new string ids that are visible only to this screen.

tagblock.name: Local Bitmaps
tagblock.tooltip: Bitmaps here allow adding a bitmap that's accessible in code for use in this screen.

plugin.comment: These are used only for level load progress bitmaps

tagRef.name: Mouse Cursor Definition
tagRef.tooltip: The mouse cursor definition for this screen.
